snippet: The elevated tone that some had anticipated from Representative Paul D. Ryan’s entrance in the race has not come to pass. Instead, strategists are pondering who benefits most from the campaigns’ vitriol.
abstract: Political Memo; the elevated tone that some had anticipated from Rep Paul D Ryan's entrance in the 2012 presidential race has not come to pass; instead, strategists are pondering whether Pres Obama or Mitt Romney benefits most from their campaigns' vitriol.
lead_paragraph: The elevated tone that some had anticipated from Representative Paul D. Ryan’s entrance in the race has not come to pass. Instead, strategists are pondering who benefits most from the campaigns’ vitriol.

headline.seo: Obama, Romney and a Campaign of Attack Ads — Political Memo
headline.main: The Lowest Common Denominator and the 2012 Race for President
headline.print_headline: The Lowest Common Denominator and the 2012 Race for President
